Test.Your Task:
Select the different 'Tree Terminology' Buttons to
explore the different parts of a tree.
Click 'Next' when finished

Select the different 'Branch Vigor' Buttons to
learn the three categories of Branch Vigor.
Click 'Next' when finished

Manipulate the (blue) Camera Sliders on the left
side of the screen to move the camera view. You
 can choose to move the camera at any time.
Click 'Next' when finished

Select the 'Labels On' button to turn on tree
terminology. To turn off the labels, select the
'Labels Off' button. You can choose to turn on these
labels at any time.
Click 'Next' when finished

Draw on the screen from points A to B to 'prune' the
tree. Click Undo to remove your draw line.
Can only draw on the screen when 'Undo' is visible.
Click 'Next' when finished

This concludes the interface tutorials.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the learning activities.

Select each button to explore the different cut types.
Click 'Next' when finished.

This concludes the Terminology Section. Click 'Next'
to proceed to the next learning activity section.

Select each button to explore how the '6 inch rule'
is applied to individual branches. You may need to
move the camera to see all branch prunes.
Click 'Next' when finished.

Manipulate the Branch Manipulation Slider
 to see how Branch Spacing affects pruning
 cut decisions. Click 'Next' when finished.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider until the spacing
between branches is 'Too Close' and you need to
use a 'Thinning Cut'.
Click 'Submit' to check your answer.

Manipulate the Branch Manipulation Slider to see
how Branch Direction affects pruning cut decisions.
You may need to move the camera to see the branch.
Click 'Next' when finished.

Manipulate the Branch Manipulation Slider until the
Branch Direction has 'Too Much Angle' and you
need a 'Thinning Cut'. You may need
 to move the camera to see the branch.
Click 'Next' when finished.

This concludes the Canopy Section. Click 'Next'
to proceed to the next learning activity section.

Manipulate the Branch Manipulation Slider
 to see how Branch Vigor affects pruning
 cut decisions. Click 'Next' when finished.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider until the branch 
is Vigorous and you need to use a 'Thinning Cut'.
Click 'Submit' to check your answer.

Identify the correct pruning cut decisions using
the drop down menus for the three labeled branches.
Click 'Submit' to check your answer.

This concludes the vigor tutorials.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the next activity.
